A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Don't believe the hype\, good movie\, not the great Star Wars film that is being proclaimed\, not a slice on Empire or a New Hope and I would say that the Force Awakens was a more enjoyable film\, wasted characters in Snoke\, Hux\, Captain Phasma (again) and I dont know what the point was for D.J's speech stutter.\nIt seems to be that the one thing that is missing is\, dear I say it Han Solo\, the saga seems to have taken a huge leap into the fantastical\, spoiler alert\, a flying indestuctible Leia and a holographic Luke Skywalker (who has gone to weight watchers and got a haircut). The character of Kylo Ren has taken a huge step backwards\, he just lacks the guts or terror that Vader processed\, every time he gets angry he either pushes someone or punches a hole in a wall (they should make a side movie about Star Wars gib stoppers). I love Star Wars\, but this film seems safe\, bloated with side characters\, and a bit of a mess\, it just seems to lack that emotional punch that we have gotten in the past.
